description:
Members of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s Workers’ Party — including its chairperson, Congresswoman Gleisi Hoffmann — on Wednesday filed a lawsuit requesting that Central Bank chairman Roberto Campos Neto be forbidden from making political statements. Mr. Campos Neto has been a lightning rod for left-wing outrage since Lula took office in January 2023, as the […]

title: Ahead of policy decision, Lula allies request gag order on Central Bank chairman

description:
Brazil's President Lula has placed huge importance on diplomacy and international politics since returning to the country's top office — though he has faced criticism for the perception that he is ignoring domestic issues

title: Explaining Brazil #298: Global ambitions, domestic neglect?

description:
Foreign Minister Mauro Vieira on Wednesday told lawmakers at the House Foreign Affairs Committee that the conditions for concluding a free-trade deal between the European Union and Mercosur (the trade alliance between Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay) remain “similar” to last year even after the recent EU Parliament election. title: For Brazil, EU-Mercosur deal status remains unchanged
